What is your overall assessment of this course
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Improved my spanish and knowledge of ecuadorian culture
I strengthened my writing skills in Spanish and learned about a wide variety of literature and cinema in Ecuador.

I was able to develop my Spanish speaking skills immensely through in-class conversations, and zoom meetings with natives of Ecuador. I also really enjoyed the fact that my knowledge on the culture and history of Ecuador was expanded so much. This really gave me insight to a country like I have never had before.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was really good at adapting to the online format with presentations, movie screenings, and guest speakers. A weakness is the classes were a little too long i would've preferred shorter classes on more days so that it would be easier to stay engaged.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Definitely  Professor Tortora designs the course very well with her readings and viewings in class which ensure that a lot of content is covered while making time for oral practice in small groups.
Yes! I loved both the Professor and TA as they made the course very engaging, even though it was all online! I would say I learned much more than I expected, and my Spanish skills improved a lot.
